definition: a mathematical expression from which another expression is derived
opposite_reasoning: PhysicalEntity provides the strongest and most fundamental opposition to SymbolicString. This captures the core abstract-physical dichotomy in SUMO ontology: SymbolicStrings are purely abstract representations (text, symbols, data) with no physical properties, while PhysicalEntities are concrete objects occupying space. This opposition is well-established in SUMO, highly available, and creates a clear Fisher-LDA axis separating abstract symbolic representations from physical objects. While not directly relevant to deception detection, it provides a robust foundational axis for distinguishing representation types. The opposition is semantically strong (8/10) and extremely reliable (exists in both WordNet and SUMO with high confidence).
